intro: Maytenus wendtii, commonly known as the Brazilian mayten, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rutaceae. It is native to Brazil and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its fruit is a small, woody capsule that contains several seeds. Maytenus wendtii is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in well-drained soils and full sunlight.
